StudyInfo.StudyNameEntrez: The QChip1 Knowledgebase and Microarray for Precision Medicine in Qatar

Policy.acknowledgement_statement: This is a collaborative work between Qatar Genome, Qatar Biobank, Weill Cornell (New York and Qatar), Hamad Medical Corporation and Sidra Medicine. Key collaborators include Dr. Fatemeh Abbaszadeh, for quality control and implementing QChip in the diagnostic services; N. Mohamed for editorial support, E. Betancourt for administrative support, E. Guzman for IT support, J. Pillardy for high-performance computing support, and Alan R Shuldiner and Regeneron Pharmaceuticals Inc. Alphonse Tharangeval at the Dasman Diabetes Institute in Kuwait provided allele frequency lookups, and the Center for Arab Genetic Studies in UAE, the GME Variome at University of California at San Diego, and the Iranomefor provided public access to their databases. These studies were supported, in part, by The Qatar Foundation and the Weill Cornell Medical College in Qatar; Qatar National Research Foundation NPRP 09-741-3-193; NPRP 5-436-3-116; NPRP 7-1425-3-370; NPRP 7-1301-3-336; NPRP P8-1913-3-396.

ConsentGroup.title: General Research Use (PUB)
ConsentGroup.name: GRU-PUB
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: Use of the data is limited only by the terms of the model Data Use Certification. Requestor agrees to make results of studies using the data available to the larger scientific community.
